prompt:
I have the following count table for an RNA-seq experiment, rows are genes and columns are samples, "Supplementary_Table_1_exp.xlsx". The first column of the file is my gene names and the rest of the columns are samples. My annotation data is here  "SRP021193.colData.tsv", it contains sample annotations and rows of this matches the columns of count table, first column is the sample ids. Find genes specific for each "group" in my annotation data  using statistical tests. Plot PCA only using "group" specific genes and color code PCA by "group" variable in my annotation data.

response:
```
# Load required libraries
library(readxl)
library(dplyr)
library(pcaMethods)
library(ggplot2)

# Read count table
count_table <- read_excel("Supplementary_Table_1_exp.xlsx")

# Read annotation data
annotation_data <- read.table("SRP021193.colData.tsv", header = TRUE, sep = "\t")

# Specify groups to test
groups <- unique(annotation_data$group)

# Perform statistical tests for each group
group_specific_genes <- list()

for (group in groups) {
  # Subset count table and annotation data for the current group
  subset_count_table <- count_table[, annotation_data$group == group]
  subset_annotation_data <- annotation_data[annotation_data$group == group, ]
  
  # Perform differential expression analysis
  results <- edgeR::exactTest(subset_count_table)
  
  # Select genes with significant differential expression
  significant_genes <- subset_count_table[rowSums(results$tests$p < 0.05) > 0, ]
  
  # Save group specific genes
  group_specific_genes[[group]] <- significant_genes
}

# Combine group specific genes into a single dataframe
group_specific_genes <- do.call(rbind, group_specific_genes)

# Perform PCA using group specific genes
pca_data <- prcomp(t(group_specific_genes))

# Extract PCA scores
pca_scores <- as.data.frame(pca_data$x)

# Add group variable from annotation data to PCA scores dataframe
pca_scores$group <- annotation_data$group

# Plot PCA with color coded groups
ggplot(pca_scores, aes(x = PC1, y = PC2, color = group)) +
  geom_point() +
  labs(x = "PC1", y = "PC2") + 
  theme_minimal()
```
Note: Make sure to adjust the file paths in the `read_excel` and `read.table` functions according to the location of your files. Also, ensure that you have the necessary libraries installed before running the code.
